title: Chicken Pot Pie
instructions: In a saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Stir in flour until well combined and cook for about 1 minute.
Gradually stir in chicken broth and milk, and cook until the mixture thickens and is smooth.
Add salt, pepper, garlic powder, thyme, and parsley. Mix in the chicken, peas, carrots, onion, and celery.
Roll out one pie crust and fit it into a 9-inch pie plate. Pour the chicken mixture into the crust.
Cover with the second pie crust. Trim, seal, and flute the edges. Cut slits in the top crust to allow steam to escape.
Brush the top with beaten egg.
Bake in the preheated oven for 30 to 35 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown.
Let the pie cool for 10 minutes before serving.
